revised_title: Effects of the Extraordinary Heat in July 1757 and Its Health Consequences
tldr: In 1757, John Huxham, M.D., reported the extreme heat experienced during July and its effects on human health. The excessive heat led to various health issues, including hemorrhages, headaches, vertigo, fevers, and digestive problems. Huxham also discussed the treatment methods used during that time, such as bleeding. Despite the high number of people affected, the mortality rate was relatively low.
